description: v1.0.6 Fixes a bug with Grafana setting datasource "uid": "${DS_PROMETHEUS}" causing some user panels not to successfully load. Fix involves manually overriding with "uid": "$datasource". Enhancement: Connect null values <1hr..

options.content:
# **PURE** STORAGE

## Overview
This dashboard provides performance and capacity details for Pure Storage FlashArrays.
Group arrays by customer defined environment, whole fleets, or view arrays individually.

targets.expr: sum(purefa_alerts_open{instance=~"$instance", env=~"$env", severity="info"}) by (instance) OR on() sum(purefa_alerts_open{instance=~"$instance", env=~"$env"}*0) by (instance)
sum(purefa_alerts_open{instance=~"$instance", env=~"$env", severity="warning"}) by (instance) OR on() sum(purefa_alerts_open{instance=~"$instance", env=~"$env"}*0) by (instance)
sum(purefa_alerts_open{instance=~"$instance", env=~"$env", severity="critical"}) by (instance) OR on() sum(purefa_alerts_open{instance=~"$instance", env=~"$env"}*0) by (instance)
sum(purefa_alerts_open{instance=~"$instance", env=~"$env", severity=".*"}) by (instance) OR on() sum(purefa_alerts_open{instance=~"$instance", env=~"$env"}) by (instance)

options.content:
## Metrics

All metrics are prefixed with purefa_
Below are the metrics names available
```
* alerts_open
* array_performance_average_bytes
* array_performance_bandwidth_bytes
* array_performance_latency_usec
* array_performance_queue_depth_ops
* array_performance_throughput_iops
* array_space_bytes
* array_space_data_reduction_ratio
* array_space_utilization
* directory_performance_average_bytes
* directory_performance_bandwidth_bytes
* directory_performance_latency_usec
* directory_performance_throughput_iops
* directory_space_bytes
* directory_space_data_reduction_ratio
* host_connections_info
* host_performance_average_bytes
* host_performance_bandwidth_bytes
* host_performance_latency_usec
* host_performance_throughput_iops
* host_space_bytes
* host_space_data_reduction_ratio
* host_space_size_bytes
* hw_component_status
* hw_component_temperature_celsius
* hw_component_voltage_volt
* info
* pod_performance_average_bytes
* pod_performance_bandwidth_bytes
* pod_performance_latency_usec
* pod_performance_throughput_iops
* pod_space_bytes
* pod_space_data_reduction_ratio
* volume_performance_average_bytes
* volume_performance_bandwidth_bytes
* volume_performance_latency_usec
* volume_performance_throughput_iops
* volume_space_bytes
* volume_space_data_reduction_ratio
```

panels.title: Average Total Bandwidth for $instance array(s) bytes SI
Average Data Reduction Ratio for $instance array(s)
Sum of Space Utilization by $instance array(s)
Average IOPS by IO Type and $instance array(s)

panels.description:
This query is very expensive on Prometheus and the browser. For large environments it may be advisable to reduce scope by using the filter and narrower time frame, use a tabular view or create a recording rule.

https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/querying/basics/#avoiding-slow-queries-and-overloads

targets.expr:
avg(purefa_volume_performance_latency_usec{env=~"$env", instance=~"$instance"}) by (instance,dimension,name)
and
topk($TopItems, avg(rate(purefa_volume_performance_latency_usec{env=~"$env", instance=~"$instance"}[$__range] @ end() )) by (instance,dimension,name))

panels.title: Average Top $TopItems Latent Volumes by $instance array(s) & IO type

targets.expr:
avg(purefa_host_performance_throughput_iops{env=~"$env", instance=~"$instance", dimension="reads_per_sec"}) by (instance,host)
and
topk($TopItems, avg(rate(purefa_host_performance_throughput_iops{env=~"$env", instance=~"$instance", dimension="reads_per_sec"}[$__range] @ end() )) by (instance,host))

panels.title: Average Top $TopItems Read Throughput by $instance array(s) & Hosts

targets.expr:
avg(purefa_host_performance_throughput_iops{env=~"$env", instance=~"$instance", dimension="writes_per_sec"}) by (instance,host)
and
topk($TopItems, avg(rate(purefa_host_performance_throughput_iops{env=~"$env", instance=~"$instance", dimension="writes_per_sec"}[$__range] @ end() )) by (instance,host))

panels.title: Average Top $TopItems Write Throughput by $instance array(s) & Hosts

panels.description:
* Recommended for single array only.

* Panel will display "No Data" until there is at least 12 hours of data in the data source as this panel displays the last 90 days at 12 hour intervals.

* purefa_array_space_bytes{space=total_provisioned, *_effective} metrics NOT available when a file system on the array has unlimited provisioned size.

targets.expr:
sum(purefa_array_space_bytes{instance=~"^$instance",env=~"^$env",space=~"total_provisioned"}) by (space)
#"total_provisioned and *_effective metrics NOT available when a file system on the array has unlimited provisioned size."

panels.title: Capacity Utilization by Type & $instance array(s)

list.description: Display Pure Storage dashboard release version
list.name: DashboardVersion

title: Pure Storage FlashArray - Overview
